description: From post-classical Latin systasis, and its source, Ancient Greek σύστασις (sústasis, “composition, construction”), from συν- (sun-, “syn-”) + στάσις (stásis, “stasis”).

entries.meaning: The combination of different elements; synthesis. [from 17th c.]
(obsolete, rare) A union or confederation. [18th c.]
examples: The municipal army […] is a worse preservative of a general constitution, than the systasis of Crete, or the confederation of Poland.
